data.title: The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute
data.meta_description: The Lee Strasberg Institute in New York and Los Angeles is home for all actors seeking to discover Method Acting and its tradition of training the most brilliant actors.
data.meta_site_name: The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute
data.text:
Acting, Theatre & Film School

Visit the School

Join us at one of our Open House events to learn more about Method Acting and our campuses.

Apply Now for 2024-2025 Programs

Apply Now for 2024-2025 Programs

Discover

The Method

As the only acting school in the world that teaches Lee Strasberg’s work in its consummate form, The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute® is the home for all actors seeking to delve into Method Acting and its tradition of training some of the world’s most brilliant and truthful actors.

The Lee Strasberg Film Festival

The Lee Strasberg Film Festival is a three-day celebration of independent cinema and exceptional acting, brought to you by The Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute. Submissions for the festival are now open!

Our Alumni

Our alumni have found incredible success in the fields of Film, Television, & Stage. Of the many students who called Lee Strasberg their teacher, or the Lee Strasberg Theatre & Film Institute their home, they all honor his legacy with their incredible work and talent.

Testimonial

“When you come here, you know that they are giving you gold. This Institute is giving gold to the actors. They tell you things that no one else will tell you, things that are useful not only when you’re working but also when you’re not.”

– Emilio Rafael Treviño

Blog

Spend the Summer at LSTFI’s Young Actors Program

Each summer, LSTFI offers two-week programs for kids and teens in grades 2-12. Students travel from all five boroughs - and all over the world - to learn Lee Strasberg's Method Acting.

Introducing the Kevin Corrigan Scholarship Recipient, Kila Ever

Young Actors at Strasberg student Kila Ever stars in Blue Bloods season 13 and more!

Breaking Boundaries: From Kazakhstan to Tribeca Spotlight

LSTFI alumna Saltanat Nuaruz stars in Bikechess, the film winning Best International Narrative at the 2024 Tribeca Film Festival!
